frameDefinitions: One phenomenon, the Predictive_phenomenon is an indication of the future or current (but still uncertain) existence of another phenomenon, the Future_phenomenon.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
In this frame an Evaluee is described by a (usually implicit)
A Protagonist needs a Means action performed for their Benefit.
Words in this frame describe the status of an Action with respect to a Code of laws or rules.
In this frame an Evaluee is judged by a (usually implicit)
frameExamples: It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
That was very <t>righteous</t> of you to help him.
(1) I <t>rely</t> on you to see that my name is not sullied.
<t>Illegal</t> drug use is on the rise.
It was <t>nice</t> of you to send a card.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> provides evidence for the existence or the nature of the <fen>Outcome</fen> of <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> is that phenomenon that is predicted to occur or have a particular quality.
The role <fen>Outcome</fen> identifies those expressions that indicate how the <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> is expected to turn out based on the evidence of the <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the omen is occuring.
The location where something good or bad might occur.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
This is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality.
The assessment of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which is the basis of the evaluation of morality.
The person or thing whose needs are served by the <fen>Means</fen> action.
An action or state that the <fen>Means</fen> action brings about and from which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> profits.
The person or thing that performs a <fen>Means</fen> action to the <fen>Benefit</fen> of the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
An object that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> uses to realize a <fen>Benefit</fen>.
An action or state that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> wants to bring about.  It is more or less the <fen>Benefit</fen> viewed in relation to the <fen>Protagonist</fen> rather than the <fen>Means</fen>.
An action performed either by the <fen>Protagonist</fen> or an <fen>Intermediary</fen> that has a <fen>Benefit</fen> for  the <fen>Protagonist</fen> attached to it.
The <fen>Action</fen> is the behavior which complies with or violates the <fen>Code</fen>.
The <fen>Object</fen> complies with or violates the <fen>Code</fen> by virtue of its existence, location or possession.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> towards other human beings is being evaluated.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen> is the entity which is positively or negatively treated by the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the action of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> on which the evaluation of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s character is based.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the situation or person that the <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s <fen>Behavior</fen> responds to or is related to.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the evaluation denoted by the target.
listRoleExamples: <fex>To achieve so much this year</fex> augurs well for the future.
This move presages <fex>a freeze on the granting of new concessions</fex>.
It all bodes <fex>well</fex> for the future.
The storm bodes ill for you <fex>here</fex> .
<fex>Everyone</fex> has the obligation to vote.
My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.
It was honorable <fex>of Jackie</fex> to give up the position.
<fex>Accepting that money</fex> was immoral of Lindsay.
His face twisted into an evil <fex>grin</fex>
<fex>I</fex> rely on this walking stick to get me around
He still relies on me <fex>to do the head work</fex>
We rely <fex>on you</fex> for feedback and input
I hate having to rely <fex>on my car</fex> to get where I want to go
The user will quickly begin to rely on the pills <fex>to cope with life pressures</fex>.
We rely <fex>on your response</fex>
Illegal <fex>drug use</fex> is on the rise.
She flashed me a kind <fex>smile</fex>.
<fex>In my book</fex>, that wasn't very gracious.
